permits.otherIdentifier: Polynesian Adventure Tours, Inc. - Lihue BASEYARD

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText:
SEE P 1-5 OF TMDL.

GEOMETRIC MEAN NOT TO EXCEED THE GIVEN VALUE
(WET SEASON 250 UG/L/DRY SEASON 180 UG/L)

NOT TO EXCEED THE GIVEN VALUE MORE THAN 10
PERCENT OF THE TIME(WET SEASON 520 UG/L/DRY SEASON 380 UG/L) 

NOT TO EXCEED THE GIVEN
VALUE MORE THAN 2 PERCENT OF THE TIME
(WET SEASON 800 UG/L/DRY SEASON 600 UG/L)

SEE P 1-6 OF TMDL.

FOR ENTEROCOCCUS (BACTERIAL INDICATOR) IN INLAND RECREATIONAL WATERS (HAR ยง11-54-8(A)):
(1) ENTEROCOCCUS CONTENT SHALL NOT EXCEED A GEOMETRIC MEAN OF 33 PER ONE HUNDRED MILLILITERS IN NOT LESS
THAN FIVE SAMPLES WHICH SHALL BE SPACED TO COVER A PERIOD BETWEEN 25 AND 30 DAYS. NO SINGLE
SAMPLE SHALL EXCEED THE SINGLE SAMPLE MAXIMUM OF 89 CFU PER 100 MILLILITERS OR THE SITE-SPECIFIC
ONE-SIDED 82 PER CENT CONFIDENCE LIMIT. INLAND RECREATIONAL WATERS IN WHICH ENTEROCOCCUS CONTENT
DOES NOT EXCEED THE STANDARD SHALL NOT BE LOWERED IN QUALITY.
(2) AT LOCATIONS WHERE SAMPLING IS LESS FREQUENT THAN FIVE SAMPLES PER TWENTY-FIVE TO THIRTY DAYS, NO SINGLE
SAMPLE SHALL EXCEED THE SINGLE SAMPLE MAXIMUM NOR SHALL THE GEOMETRIC MEAN OF THESE SAMPLES
TAKEN DURING THE 30-DAY PERIOD EXCEED 33 CFU PER 100 MILLILITERS.

permits.otherIdentifier: Polynesian Adventure Tours, Inc. - Lihue BASEYARD

actions.actionName: Turbidity, Sediment, and Nutrient Total Maximum Daily Loads for the Waikele Watershed (Oahu, Hawaii)

documents.documentName: EPA Approval Letter: Waikele Turbidity, Sediment and Nutrient TMDL

documents.documentFileName: Appendix C Waikele Supplemental Loading Calculation Information.pdf

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText:
Geometric Mean:
250 ug/L (Wet Season); 180 ug/L (Dry Season)

10% Exceedance Value:
520 ug/L (Wet Season); 380 ug/L (Dry Season)

2% Exceedance Value:
800 ug/L (Wet Season); 600 ug/L (Dry Season)

Wet season = November 1 through April 30; Dry season = May 1 through October 31
(Source: Waikele TMDL Report)

Geometric Mean:
70 ug/L (Wet Season); 30 ug/L (Dry Season)

10% Exceedance Value:
180 ug/L (Wet Season); 90 ug/L (Dry Season)

2% Exceedance Value:
300 ug/L (Wet Season); 170 ug/L (Dry Season)

Wet season = November 1 through April 30; Dry season = May 1 through October 31
(Source: Waikele TMDL Report)

Total Suspended Solids:

Geometric Mean:
 20 mg/L (Wet Season); 10 mg/L (Dry Season)

10% Exceedance Value:
50 mg/L (Wet Season); 30 mg/L (Dry Season)

2% Exceedance Value:
80 mg/L (Wet Season); 55 mg/L (Dry Season)

Turbidity:
Geometric Mean:
 5 NTU (Wet Season); 2 NTU (Dry Season)

10% Exceedance Value:
15 NTU (Wet Season); 5.5 NTU (Dry Season)

2% Exceedance Value:
25 NTU (Wet Season); 10 NTU (Dry Season)

Wet season = November 1 through April 30; Dry season = May 1 through October 31
Total suspended solids numeric targets were used as a surrogate for turbidity impairments

(Source: Waikele TMDL Report)
